p: Since the SARS-CoV outbreak in 2002â€“2003, numerous approaches have been used to develop therapeutic agents and vaccines for coronaviruses ( Table 2). The recent COVID-19 pandemic has further accelerated the efforts to find cure and protection. Typically, three general methods are employed for antiviral treatment of coronaviruses [ 80]: (i) application of existing broad-spectrum antiviral drugs; (ii) screening of chemical libraries containing many existing compounds or databases; (iii) redevelopment of new specific drugs based on the genome and biophysical understanding of individual coronaviruses. Other options include monoclonal antibodies and viral receptor blockers [ 81]. Products developed as Chinese traditional medicines have also been suggested [ 80]. In line with gene therapy applications, the design of various gene silencing approaches has been initiated based on RNA interference (RNAi) [ 82]. In the context of vaccine development, a wide variety of immunization strategies have been initiated [ 83].
